name.value: FHIR Connectathon 17 - Terminology Services - CodeSystem Validate Code - LOINC - NOT OK - GET - XML

description.value: CodeSystem $validate-code tests against known LOINC codes where the expected outcome is a failure response and either a valid Parameters payload with a result value false and a message value, or an OperationOutcome. All $validate-code operations are performed using the FHIR Operation Framework HTTP GET method.
CodeSystem $validate-code operation

Validate code test for LOINC code system using HTTP GET with code='11378-7' and invalid display='Systolic blood pressure at First encounterX'. Expected response is 200 (OK) with a Parameters payload containing the result value false and a message value.
Test $validate-code operation on the LOINC code system for a valid code and invalid display.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned format is XML.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Parameters.
Confirm that the returned Parameters resource type conforms the base FHIR specification.
Confirm that the returned Parameters minimally contains the information in validate-code-invalid-min.
Validate code test for LOINC code system using HTTP GET with invalid code='11378-7X'. Expected response is 200 (OK) with a Parameters payload containing the result value false and a message value.
Test $validate-code operation on the LOINC code system for an valid code.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK).
Confirm that the returned format is XML.
Confirm that the returned resource type is Parameters.
Confirm that the returned Parameters resource type conforms the base FHIR specification.
Confirm that the returned Parameters minimally contains the information in validate-code-invalid-min.

Validate code test for LOINC code system using HTTP GET with invalid system='http://loinc.orgX' and code='11378-7'. Expected response is 4xx/5xx with an OperationOutcome payload containing at least one error issue.
Test $validate-code operation on the LOINC code system for an valid code.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 4xx/5xx.
Confirm that the returned format is XML.
Confirm that the returned resource type is OperationOutcome.
Confirm that the returned OperationOutcome resource type conforms the base FHIR specification.
Confirm that the returned OperationOutcome resource contains at least one error or fatal issue.
